name: Teeny Tiny Screen-printed Quilt 10
description:
This is a little contemporary quilted textile by Ruth de Vos. The artwork features fabric hand-printed by Ruth, as well as commercial fabric, and includes machine- and hand-quilting.

(c) Ruth de Vos 2013

Size: 19 cm H by 19 cm W
Materials: cotton and cotton-linen blend fabric
Techniques: screen-printed, machine pieced, hand and machine quilted

This artwork would look great in a nursery or child's bedroom, either alone, in a row of three, or in an array of four.

This artwork comes unframed, but has been mounted on foamcore board with velcro. This means that it is all ready to pop right into a 25cm by 25cm picture from (I use the IKEA RIBBA frames). (I remove the glass, which gives room enough for the foamcore board).

If you live in Australia, I can send yours framed for an additional $18.

View more of my artwork at www.ruthdevos.com

name: 'Rejoice' print (unframed)
description:
This screen-print is made by hand by textile artist Ruth de Vos. Ruth is inspired by the childhood journey of discovery that all little children are on.

The children and the child's drawing are screen-printed onto a background of watercolour paper, and the word 'rejoice' has been cut out of paper and stitched into place.

Paper size: 21cm by 29.7cm (A4 size)

The print comes unframed, but is shown here in an IKEA RIBBA picture frame.

Your print will be posted to you wrapped in plastic, with sturdy cardboard for support.

name: 'Be Glad' print (unframed)
description:
This screen-print is made by hand by textile artist Ruth de Vos. Ruth is inspired by the childhood journey of discovery that all little children are on.

The children and the child's drawing are screen-printed onto a background of watercolour paper, and the words 'be glad' have been cut out of paper and stitched into place.

Paper size: 21cm by 29.7cm (A4 size)

The print comes unframed, but is shown here in an IKEA RIBBA picture frame.

Your print will be posted to you wrapped in plastic, with sturdy cardboard for support.

name: Little Boy Pointing print
description:
This screen-print is made by hand by textile artist Ruth de Vos. Ruth is inspired by the childhood journey of discovery that all little children are on.

The little boy is printed onto a background of watercolour paper and screen-printed vintage textbook pages.

Paper size: 21cm by 29.7cm (A4 size)

Your print will be posted to you wrapped in plastic, with sturdy cardboard for support.

name: A Joyful Heart
description:
'A Joyful Heart' is a contemporary quilted textile by Ruth de Vos. The artwork is hand-dyed, machine-pieced and machine-quilted by the artist.

(c) Ruth de Vos 2013

Size: 76 cm H by 81 cm W
Materials: cotton linen blend, cotton homespun, cotton batting
Techniques: machine-pieced, machine-quilted

The price and postage costs are for the unframed artwork.

This artwork has a sleeve stitched onto the back for hanging purposes, and can be hung using a gallery-style hanging system, or with two screws in the wall. More info including pictures here: http://ruthdevos.com/blog/how-to-hang-an-art-quilt/

The artwork is also shown framed. To purchase the artwork framed, there will be extra costs of $100 for the frame plus extra postage. I will need to quote you on the postage based on where it would need to be shipped to. You can email me (ruth{at}ruthdevos.com) for a quote.

View more of my artwork at www.ruthdevos.com

name: 'I Am a Child' play quilt
description:
Every child loves a quilt for snuggling in, building forts with, playing on, or hiding under!

These play quilts feature screen-printed panels, some of the inspired by children's drawings. The quilts are completely handmade by textile artist Ruth de Vos. 

They measure 116 cm by 117 cm and can be washed by machine on a gentle cycle.

Be sure to check out the Little Man softies and the Caleb softies which coordinate with these quilts! 

In keeping with the nature of handmade products, there will be slight differences from one quilt to another.

name: Caleb softie
description:
Early childhood drawings of people are my absolute favourite! This little guy is a self-portrait by Caleb.

With Caleb's permission, he's now available in softie form! Screen-printed by hand onto cotton fabric, these little men make a fun addition to any bed, nursery or playroom. They are stuffed with durable polyester fibrefill, which means they can be machine washed on a gentle cycle.

Size: 38cm by 35cm by 12cm.

Handmade by Ruth de Vos
Be sure to check out the coordinating play quilts.

name: Little Man softie
description:
Early childhood drawings of people are my absolute favourite! This little man, drawn by my son Aaron first made an appearance in my art quilt "What does YOUR family look like?" 
http://ruthdevos.bigcartel.com/product/what-does-your-family-look-like

Now he's available in softie form! Screen-printed by hand onto cotton fabric, these little men make a fun addition to any bed, nursery or playroom. They are stuffed with durable polyester fibrefill, which means they can be machine washed on a gentle cycle.

Size: 45cm by 35cm by 15cm.

Handmade by Ruth de Vos
Be sure to check out the coordinating play quilts.

name: Screen-printed Scrap Quilt
description:
Made by textile artist Ruth de Vos, these scrap quilts are made from hundreds of pieces of her own screen-printed fabrics. They showcase fabric from many of Ruth's projects from the past few years.

Perfect for picnicking, or snuggling under, or even building forts, each quilt measures 136cm by 124cm. Made with textile paint and (predominantly) cotton or linen fabric.

Hand washing recommended.

© Ruth de Vos 2013

View Ruth's artwork on her website:
http://www.ruthdevos.com
or check out current work-in-progress on her blog:
http://www.ruthdevos.com/blog

name: 'to be a child' tea towel
description:
Designed by Ruth de Vos © 2012
Screen printed by hand by Ruth de Vos

75% linen, 25% cotton
50cm by 70cm

These tea towels are screen printed by hand and there are therefore minor variations between them. That is part of what makes 'handmade' so special!

One image shows tea towel displayed in an IKEA RIBBA frame (50cm by 70cm, not included).

If you are purchasing a gift and would like me to send it directly to the recipient, I can include a little handmade gift card with the message of your choice. Just let me know during checkout, or by emailing me: ruth{at}ruthdevos.com.

name: Boundaries
description:
It is the place of children to test and confirm the healthy boundaries that we as parents set for them.

'Boundaries' is a contemporary quilted textile by Ruth de Vos. The artwork is hand-dyed, screen-printed, machine-pieced and machine-quilted by the artist.

(c) Ruth de Vos 2012

Size: 97 cm H by 106 cm W
Materials: procion fabric dye, cotton homespun, cotton batting
Techniques: hand-dyed, machine pieced, machine quilted

name: Read Me a Story
description:
Once upon a time there were some small children who loved to read books. Page after page, book after book, they devoured the pictures and stories. ‘Please read us a story,’ they would say to every unsuspecting visitor.

'Read Me a Story' is a contemporary quilted textile by Ruth de Vos. The artwork is hand-dyed, screen-printed, machine-pieced and machine-quilted by the artist.

(c) Ruth de Vos 2010

Size: 149 cm H by 144 cm W
Materials: procion fabric dye, texcraft fabric paint, cotton homespun, cotton batting
Techniques: hand-dyed, screen-printed, machine pieced, machine quilted

This artworks has a sleeve stitched onto the back for hanging purposes, and can be hung using a gallery-style hanging system, or with two screws in the wall. More info including pictures here: http://ruthdevos.com/blog/how-to-hang-an-art-quilt/

name: See What My Hands and Feet Can Do
description:
'See What My Hands and Feet Can Do' is a contemporary quilted textile by Ruth de Vos. The artwork is hand-dyed, machine-pieced and machine-quilted by the artist.

"Babies and toddlers are continually learning new skills in their quest to explore the world around them."

(c) Ruth de Vos 2011

Size: 149cm H by 133 cm W
Materials: procion fabric dye, cotton homespun, cotton batting
Techniques: hand-dyed, machine pieced, machine quilted

name: What Does YOUR Family Look Like?
description:
Little children love to draw themselves and others near and dear to them. Tongue between teeth, they concentrate oh-so-hard on getting all the features in place. I am privileged to observe such artists at work every day!

'Taking It All In' is a contemporary quilted textile by Ruth de Vos. The artwork is hand-dyed, machine-pieced and machine-quilted by the artist.

(c) Ruth de Vos 2009

Size: 98cm H by 132 cm W
Materials: procion fabric dye, cotton homespun, cotton batting
Techniques: hand-dyed, machine pieced, machine quilted

description:

name: Whisperings
description:
Contemporary quilted artwork by Ruth de Vos. 

110cm high by 116cm wide

Salvaged wool fabric, hand-dyed cotton fabric, cotton batting.
Hand-dyed, machine-pieced, hand- and machine-quilted.

"A gentle breeze rustles through the leaves as the whisper little stories to one another."

This quilt was made for – and accepted into – Expressions 2008, the Wool Quilt Prize held at the National Wool Museum. It was quilt a different experience to work with wool fabric (only the stems are cotton) but one which I found myself thoroughly enjoying, to my surprise

This artworks has a sleeve stitched onto the back for hanging purposes, and can be hung using a gallery-style hanging system, or with two screws in the wall. More info including pictures here: http://ruthdevos.com/blog/how-to-hang-an-art-quilt/
